intro: Ramischia secunda var. elatior, commonly known as the greater ramischia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure, making it suitable for rock gardens or alpine settings. Its foliage is narrow and grass-like, contributing to its ornamental value in horticultural landscapes. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat challenging species to cultivate.
